info.title: Gate Express
info.description:
Gate Express API specification


# Request signature
  All types of messages contain the parameter X-REQUEST-SIGNATURE in the HTTP header, which contains the test value of the request, calculated using the HMAC algorithm. When implementing message validation, pay attention to the following points:
  
  Message contains:
  
      1 Reguest method
      2 URL
      3 X-SITE-ID
      4 X-REQUEST-ID
      5 Request body
  
  Example:
  
      POST
      /payments/requests/single
      16
      1qazxsw23edc
      {"Amount": 123, "Currency": "RUB", "ExtraData": {"custom": "field", "key": "value"}, "CustomerInfo": {"Address": "string", "Country": "string", "Email": "string", "Language": "string", "Phone": "string", "Town": "string", "ZIP": "string"}, "Description": "string", "OrderId": "string", "PaymentMethod": "card", "PaymentDetails": {"CardholderName": "string", "CardNumber": "4111111111111111", "CVC": "987", "ExpMonth": "12", "ExpYear": "22"}, "RebillFlag": true}
       
  
  Use parameter secret as the key, example:
  
      "sk16" 
  
  Hash is calculated by the SHA256 function (we get the data in hexadecimal (!) encoding in lower case):
  
      "e31f6486797d4d9677a42b53435f0734ee7eae07799a1cad7569df2a9bf2dfb2" 
  
  Sites for online signature generation verification::
  
      http://beautifytools.com/hmac-generator.php
  
  X-REQUEST-SIGNATURE sample (Python)::
  
      import hashlib
      import hmac

      def calc_signature(body: str, site_secret_value: str) -> str:
          signatire = hmac.new(
            key=site_secret_value.decode(),
            msg=body.decode(),
            digestmod=hashlib.sha256,
          )
          return signatire.hexdigest()
      
      
  Signature sample (PHP)::
  
  
        function getSignature($body, $secretKey)
          {
              $hash = hash_hmac('sha256', $body, $secretKey, false);
              return $hash;
          }


# Webhook signature
   X-WEBHOOK-SIGNATURE calculated in the same way as [Request signature](#section/Request-signature), excluding X-REQUEST-ID. 
  
  Message contains:
  
      1 Reguest method
      2 URL
      3 X-SITE-ID
      5 Request body
  
  Example:
  
      POST
      /payments/requests/single
      16
      {"Amount": 123, "Currency": "RUB", "ExtraData": {"custom": "field", "key": "value"}, "CustomerInfo": {"Address": "string", "Country": "string", "Email": "string", "Language": "string", "Phone": "string", "Town": "string", "ZIP": "string"}, "Description": "string", "OrderId": "string", "PaymentMethod": "card", "PaymentDetails": {"CardholderName": "string", "CardNumber": "4111111111111111", "CVC": "987", "ExpMonth": "12", "ExpYear": "22"}, "RebillFlag": true}
       
  
  Use parameter secret as the key, example:
  
      "sk16" 
  
  Hash is calculated by the SHA256 function (we get the data in hexadecimal (!) encoding in lower case):
  
      "a45fc5c47ef468889bbb906409c2b93ad8653f7e896ce3f4d4d3f560419af52b"

post.description: One-step payment operation – funds are deducted from the card immediately after the operation is carried out. Additionally, it is possible to specify rebillFlag for pre-authorization of a recurring payment.

Two-step payment operation – funds are blocked on the card. If hold was successful, compete the transaction in 5 days, if you do not confirm the operation with a Charge request within 5 days, the funds will be automatically canceled. Additionally, it is possible to specify rebillFlag for pre-authorization of a recurring payment.
An operation of automatic funds deduction from a previously linked card.
Is used by Pay or Block operations with 3DS Secure after receiving the results of authentication from the bank to complete a one-step	wo-step payment operation.
Only a successful transaction can be refunded.
Unblocking funds on card during the two-step payment operation executed earlier.
Charge funds from the card during the two-step payment operation executed earlier.
Credit transaction is a type of transaction, where funds are transferred to cardholder's account. The funds are credited to the card within two banking days.

get.description: The operation checks the available balance for Payout.

post.description: It is executed after the payment has been successfully completed - authorization received from the issuer. It serves to inform about the payment: the system sends a request to the address of the merchant with payment information, and the merchant's service must record the fact of payment.

Country.description: Country code of issuer card in ISO.

Amount.description: Transaction ammount. From 1 to 12 digits, dot ‘.’ is used as decimal separator.

Currency.description: ISO currency in alphabetic code (USD, EUR, etc.)

PayOnlyFlag.description: A sign of the type of payment of the parent transaction. Possible values (default true): false - use the type of payment (BLOCK/PAY) of the parent transaction, true - use the payment type (always PAY).

CardNumber.description: Card number. 12 to 19 digits without spaces.

ExpMonth.description: Card expire mounth. 2 figures with a leading zero.

ExpYear.description: Card expire year. Last 2 figures of the year.

CardHolder.description: Cardholder name (on the front of the card). Acceptable symbols[a-Z.,-].

Email.description: customer email, for recurrent payments. This email should not be transferred to the bank, this email to inform customer - saved in the transaction.

Address.description: Customer's address, specified at the registration of the card in the bank. May be present if the cardholder's address verification is supported.

Town.description: Customer's city, specified at the registration of the card in the bank. May be present if the cardholder's address verification is supported.

ZIP.description: Customer's postcode, specified when the card is in the bank. It may be present if the cardholder's address verification is supported.

ProcessingAmount.description: Amount of payment in the currency in which the transaction was carried out in the bank. Matches the result from the processing.

ProcessingCurrency.description: The currency code in which the transaction was transferred to the bank. Matches the result from the processing.

Status.description: Post-authorization payment status: CHARGED for one-step payments, BLOCKED for two-step payments.

Balance.description: Available Payout ammount at the time of request.
